title: JSON schema for Packer JSON files

digitalOceanBuilder.description: Builder for creating a DigitalOcean droplets

api_token.description: The client token to use to access your account.

api_url.description: Non standard api endpoint URL. Set this if you are using a DigitalOcean API compatible service.

droplet_name.description: The name assigned to the droplet. DigitalOcean sets the hostname of the machine to this value.

image.description: The name (or slug) of the base image to use. This is the image that will be used to launch a new droplet and provision it.

private_networking.description: Specifies whether to enable private networking for the droplet being created.

region.description: The name of the region to launch the droplet in.

size.description: The name of the droplet size to use.

snapshot_name.description: The name of the resulting snapshot that will appear in your account.

state_timeout.description: The time to wait, as a duration string, for a droplet to enter a desired state (such as "active") before timing out.

type.description: Builder for creating a DigitalOcean droplets

user_data.description: User data to launch with the Droplet.

user_data_file.description: Path to a file that will be used for the user data when launching the Droplet.

dockerBuilder.description: Builder for creating a Docker image.

author.description: Set the author (e-mail) of a commit.

aws_access_key.description: The AWS access key used to communicate with AWS.

aws_secret_key.description: The AWS secret key used to communicate with AWS.

aws_token.description: The AWS access token to use.

changes.description: Dockerfile instructions to add to the commit. Example of instructions are CMD, ENTRYPOINT, ENV, and EXPOSE.

commit.description: If true, the container will be committed to an image rather than exported.

discard.description: Throw away the container when the build is complete.

ecr_login.description: If true, the builder will login in order to pull the image from Amazon EC2 Container Registry (ECR).

export_path.description: The path where the final container will be exported as a tar file.

image.description: The base image for the Docker container that will be started.

login.description: If true, the builder will login in order to pull the image.

login_email.description: The email to use to authenticate to login.

login_password.description: The password to use to authenticate to login.

login_server.description: The server address to login to.

login_username.description: The username to use to authenticate to login.

message.description: Set a message for the commit.

priviledged.description: If true, run the docker container with the --privileged flag.

pull.description: If true, the configured image will be pulled using docker pull prior to use.

run_command.description: An array of arguments to pass to "docker run" in order to run the container.

volumes.description: A mapping of additional volumes to mount into this container. The key of the object is the host path, the value is the container path.

type.description: Builder for creating a Docker image.

checksumPostProcessor.description: Post-processor for computing a checksum for your built artifacts.

checksum_types.description: An array of strings of checksum types to compute.

type.description: Post-processor for computing a checksum for your built artifacts.

compressPostProcessor.description: Post-processor for compressing your built artifacts.

compression_level.description: Specify the compression level, for algorithms that support it, from 1 through 9 inclusive.

format.description: Disable archive format autodetection and use provided string.

output.description: The path to save the compressed archive. The archive format is inferred from the filename.

type.description: Post-processor for compressing your built artifacts.

dockerImportPostProcessor.description: Post-processor for importing an exported Docker image in order to run other post-processors on it.

repository.description: The repository of the imported image.

tag.description: The tag for the imported image. By default this is not set.

type.description: Post-processor for importing an exported Docker image in order to run other post-processors on it.

dockerPushPostProcessor.description: Post-processor for pushing a Docker image to a remote registry.

aws_access_key.description: The AWS access key used to communicate with AWS.

aws_secret_key.description: The AWS secret key used to communicate with AWS.

aws_token.description: The AWS access token to use.

ecr_login.description: If true, the builder will login in order to pull the image from Amazon EC2 Container Registry (ECR).

login.description: If true, the post-processor will login prior to pushing.

login_email.description: The email to use to authenticate to login.

login_password.description: The password to use to authenticate to login.

login_server.description: The server address to login to.

login_username.description: The username to use to authenticate to login.

type.description: Post-processor for pushing a Docker image to a remote registry.

dockerSavePostProcessor.description: Post-processor for exporting a committed Docker image to a file.

path.description: The path to save the image (e.g. foo.tar).

type.description: Post-processor for exporting a committed Docker image to a file.

dockerTagPostProcessor.description: Post-processor for tagging a committed Docker image.

force.description: If true, this post-processor forcibly tag the image even if tag name is collided. Default to false.

tag.description: The tag for the imported image. By default this is not set.

type.description: Post-processor for tagging a committed Docker image.

localShellPostProcessor.description: Post-processor for running a local shell script.

environment_vars.description: An array of key/value pairs to inject prior to the execute_command. The format should be key=value.

execute_command.description: The command to use to execute the script. By default this is chmod +x "{{.Script}}"; {{.Vars}} "{{.Script}}".

inline.description: This is an array of commands to execute.

inline_shebang.description: The shebang value to use when running commands specified by inline. By default, this is /bin/sh -e.

script.description: The path to a script to execute.

scripts.description: An array of scripts to execute. The scripts will be executed in the order specified.

type.description: Post-processor for running a local shell script.

ansibleLocalProvisioner.description: Provisioner for running an Ansible playbook via local mode.

extra_arguments.description: An array of extra arguments to pass to the ansible command.

galaxy_file.description: A requirements file which provides a way to install roles with the ansible-galaxy cli on the remote machine.

group_vars.description: Path to the directory containing ansible group variables on your local system to be copied to the remote machine.

host_vars.description: Path to the directory containing ansible host variables on your local system to be copied to the remote machine.

inventory_file.description: The inventory file to be used by ansible. This file must exist on your local system and will be uploaded to the remote machine.

inventory_groups.description: A comma-separated list of groups to which packer will assign the host 127.0.0.1.

playbook_dir.description: Path to the complete ansible directory structure on your local system to be copied to the remote machine as the staging_directory before all other files and directories.

playbook_file.description: The playbook file to be executed by ansible. This file must exist on your local system and will be uploaded to the remote machine.

playbook_paths.description: An array of paths to playbook files on your local system. These will be uploaded to the remote machine under staging_directory/playbooks.

role_paths.description: An array of paths to role directories on your local system. These will be uploaded to the remote machine under staging_directory/roles.

staging_directory.description: The directory where all the configuration of Ansible by Packer will be placed. By default this is "/tmp/packer-provisioner-ansible-local".

type.description: Provisioner for running an Ansible playbook via local mode.

ansibleRemoteProvisioner.description: Provisioner for running an Ansible playbook via SSH/remote mode.

ansible_env_vars.description: Environment variables to set before running Ansible.

empty_groups.description: The groups which should be present in inventory file but remain empty.

extra_arguments.description: An array of extra arguments to pass to the ansible command.

groups.description: The groups into which the Ansible host should be placed. When unspecified, the host is not associated with any groups.

host_alias.description: The alias by which the Ansible host should be known.

local_port.description: The port on which to attempt to listen for SSH connections.

sftp_command.description: The command to run on the machine being provisioned by Packer to handle the SFTP protocol that Ansible will use to transfer files.

ssh_authorized_key_file.description: The SSH public key of the Ansible ssh_user.

ssh_host_key_file.description: The SSH key that will be used to run the SSH server on the host machine to forward commands to the target machine.

user.description: The ansible_user to use. Defaults to the user running packer.

type.description: Provisioner for running an Ansible playbook via SSH/remote mode.

destination.description: The path where the file will be uploaded to in the machine.

direction.description: The direction of the file transfer.

source.description: The path to a local file or directory to upload to the machine.

localShellProvisioner.description: Provisioner for running local shell scripts.

execute_command.description: The command to use to execute the script.

type.description: Provisioner for running local shell scripts.

remoteShellProvisioner.description: Provisioner for running remote shell scripts.

binary.description: If true, specifies that the script(s) are binary files, and Packer should therefore not convert Windows line endings to Unix line endings (if there are any). By default this is false.

environment_vars.description: An array of key/value pairs to inject prior to the execute_command. The format should be key=value.

execute_command.description: The command to use to execute the script. By default this is chmod +x {{ .Path }}; {{ .Vars }} {{ .Path }}.

expect_disconnect.description: Whether to error if the server disconnects us.

inline.description: This is an array of commands to execute.

inline_shebang.description: The shebang value to use when running commands specified by inline. By default, this is /bin/sh -e. If you're not using inline, then this configuration has no effect.

remote_file.description: The filename the uploaded script will have on the machine.

remote_folder.description: The folder where the uploaded script will reside on the machine.

remote_path.description: The full path to the uploaded script will have on the machine. By default this is remote_folder/remote_file, if set this option will override both remote_folder and remote_file.

script.description: The path to a script to upload and execute in the machine. This path can be absolute or relative.

scripts.description: An array of scripts to execute.

skip_clean.description: If true, specifies that the helper scripts uploaded to the system will not be removed by Packer.

skip_retry_timeout.description: The amount of time to attempt to start the remote process. By default this is 5m or 5 minutes. This setting exists in order to deal with times when SSH may restart, such as a system reboot.

type.description: Provisioner for running remote shell scripts.

builders.description: An array of one or more objects that defines the builders that will be used to create machine images for this template, and configures each of those builders.

description.description: A string providing a description of what the template does.

min_packer_version.description: A string that has a minimum Packer version that is required to parse the template.

post-processors.description: An array of one or more objects that defines the various post-processing steps to take with the built images.

provisioners.description: An array of one or more objects that defines the provisioners that will be used to install and configure software for the machines created by each of the builders.

variables.description: An object of one or more key/value strings that defines user variables contained in the template.
